Instruction: In the same Dutch oven, add another tablespoon of olive oil. Cook and stir the mushrooms in the oil until they are softened, approximately 5 minutes. Return the onion mixture to the pot.
Heat the remaining olive oil in the pot over medium heat. Sautï¿½ the chicken in the hot oil, turning occasionally, until browned, approximately 5 minutes.
Add the reserved onion mixture back into the pot; stir in chicken broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let it simmer for 15 minutes.

Combine the onion mixture, tomato sauce, black pepper, lemon juice, hot pepper sauce, and cinnamon with the simmering chicken; bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer until the chicken can be easily shredded, approximately 1 hour.
Accompany with a Greek salad and bread for dipping. When we were kids, the bread soaked in sauce was our main dish, while the chicken served as a side.
Replace bread with any cooked rice and serve the stew on top of the rice.
